episodeTitle: Unveiled! The Secret Weapons of the Sunny!
description: The Straw Hat Pirates battle against the New Fish-Man Pirates at Gyoncorde Plaza. Franky unveils two new mechanical weapons from the Thousand Sunny: the Kurosai FR-U IV motorcycle and the Brachio Tank V. The crew demonstrates their post-timeskip abilities while protecting Princess Shirahoshi from Hody Jones' forces.

events.title: Kurosai FR-U IV Debut
events.description: Franky emerges from the Thousand Sunny riding the Kurosai FR-U IV (Black Rhino FR-U IV), a giant black three-wheeled motorcycle with an armored rhino head. He uses it to barrel through and trample many of the New Fish-Man Pirates' soldiers.
events.significance: First appearance of one of the Thousand Sunny's secret weapons from Soldier Dock System Channel 4, demonstrating Franky's engineering advancements during the timeskip.

quotes.text: Feast your eyes on this! The Kurosai FR-U IV!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Franky introduces his new vehicle while riding into battle

images.description: Kurosai FR-U IV motorcycle from Thousand Sunny

events.title: Brachio Tank V Debut
events.description: Usopp, Chopper, and Nami arrive in the Brachio Tank V, a tank with a brachiosaurus-shaped cannon mouth that can be raised and lowered. They use it to take down many of the large fish-men soldiers.
events.significance: First appearance of the Thousand Sunny's second secret weapon from Soldier Dock System Channel 5, showcasing the crew's enhanced tactical capabilities.

quotes.text: Here comes the Brachio Tank V!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Introducing the tank as they enter the battlefield

images.description: Brachio Tank V from Thousand Sunny

events.title: Brook's Party Music Debut
events.description: Brook jumps in front of Shirahoshi and plays his violin, performing 'Party Music.' The music causes the New Fish-Man Pirates' Artillery Unit to hallucinate and see an amusement park with animal floats, making them dance uncontrollably.
events.significance: Demonstrates Brook's new ability to use music as a hypnotic weapon, showing his development during the timeskip as the Soul King.

quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook announces his technique while playing his violin

events.title: Quinte Tierce Fantasia Debut
events.description: While the enemies are distracted by Party Music and begin firing at the sky thinking they're setting off fireworks, Brook uses a swift draw-and-sheathing technique called Quinte Tierce Fantasia to cut down all the hypnotized soldiers.
events.significance: First appearance of Brook's enhanced swordsmanship technique, combining his musical hypnosis with precise sword strikes.

quotes.speaker: Brook
quotes.context: Brook executes his sword technique on the hypnotized enemies

events.title: Mil Fleurs, Gigantesco Mano Debut
events.description: Robin uses her Devil Fruit powers to sprout two massive legs made of hands from the ground. She then uses these gigantic legs to stomp on multiple New Fish-Man Pirates soldiers who were attempting to attack Shirahoshi.
events.significance: Showcases Robin's enhanced mastery of the Hana Hana no Mi, demonstrating her ability to create giant-sized limbs after the timeskip training.

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Robin announces her technique while sprouting giant legs

events.title: Zoro and Sanji's Competition
events.description: Zoro and Sanji engage in a friendly rivalry, competing to see who can defeat the most New Fish-Man Pirates soldiers. They bicker while fighting back-to-back against the enemy forces.
events.significance: Highlights the classic competitive dynamic between Zoro and Sanji while showcasing their combat prowess against numerous enemies.

events.title: Hody Deploys Surume
events.description: As his trump card, Hody Jones unleashes Surume the kraken, a giant creature he has been blackmailing by threatening his brothers. Hody orders Surume to attack Luffy and the Straw Hats.
events.significance: Hody attempts to use overwhelming force by deploying the massive kraken, escalating the battle at Gyoncorde Plaza.

events.title: Luffy Tames Surume Again
events.description: When Hody orders Surume to attack, Luffy instead tames the kraken again, reminding him of their earlier bond. Luffy orders Surume to stay near and protect Princess Shirahoshi. Surume betrays Hody and obeys Luffy's command.
events.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's ability to earn loyalty through kindness rather than force, turning Hody's trump card against him. Shows Luffy's promise to protect Surume's brothers at the North Pole.

quotes.text: Surume! Stay near Shirahoshi and protect her!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy commands the kraken to protect the princess instead of attacking

events.title: Straw Hats Demonstrate Post-Timeskip Strength
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates collectively showcase their enhanced abilities after the two-year timeskip, overwhelming the New Fish-Man Pirates' forces. Each crew member demonstrates new techniques and improved combat skills.
events.significance: Establishes the power progression of the Straw Hats after their training, showing they are ready for the challenges of the New World.

quotes.text: Feast your eyes on this! The Kurosai FR-U IV!
quotes.speaker: Franky
quotes.context: Introducing his new vehicle from the Thousand Sunny

quotes.text: Here comes the Brachio Tank V!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Arriving with Chopper and Nami in the tank

quotes.speaker: Robin
quotes.context: Creating giant legs to stomp enemies

quotes.text: Surume! Stay near Shirahoshi and protect her!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Commanding the kraken to protect the princess

themes.description: The episode showcases how the Straw Hats have prepared for the New World by developing new weapons, techniques, and abilities during their two-year separation.
themes.symbolism: The Thousand Sunny's secret weapons represent the crew's investment in their future and their readiness to face greater challenges.

themes.description: Luffy's ability to earn Surume's loyalty by promising to protect his brothers contrasts with Hody's method of control through threats and blackmail.
themes.symbolism: Surume's betrayal of Hody represents how genuine care and promises create stronger bonds than fear and coercion.

themes.description: The Straw Hats work together seamlessly, each using their unique abilities to protect Shirahoshi and combat the New Fish-Man Pirates.
themes.symbolism: The crew's coordinated efforts demonstrate how their time apart has made them individually stronger while maintaining their unity.

characterSpotlights.development: Franky showcases his engineering genius by unveiling the Kurosai FR-U IV, demonstrating his growth during the timeskip.
keyActions: Debuts the Kurosai FR-U IV motorcycle
Tramples through enemy forces with his new vehicle
Demonstrates the Thousand Sunny's enhanced capabilities
quotes: Feast your eyes on this! The Kurosai FR-U IV!

characterSpotlights.development: Brook reveals new combat techniques that combine his musical talents with his swordsmanship, showing his development as the Soul King.
keyActions: Uses Party Music to hypnotize enemies
Executes Quinte Tierce Fantasia to defeat hypnotized foes
Protects Shirahoshi from the Artillery Unit

characterSpotlights.development: Robin demonstrates enhanced mastery of her Devil Fruit powers, capable of creating giant-sized limbs.
keyActions: Uses Mil Fleurs, Gigantesco Mano to create massive legs

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates leadership by turning Hody's weapon against him, showing wisdom in earning loyalty through kindness.
keyActions: Turns Hody's trump card into an ally
quotes: Surume! Stay near Shirahoshi and protect her!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expanded Brook's Party Music hallucination scene with more elaborate visuals of an amusement park with animal floats, whereas the manga had a simpler depiction.

trivia.fact: Episode 556 adapts content from manga chapters 634-636, showcasing the Straw Hats' post-timeskip abilities.
The Kurosai FR-U IV and Brachio Tank V can dock together to form the Iron Pirate General Franky, though this transformation is not shown in this episode.

sources.title: Kurosai FR-U IV - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Both the Kurosai FR-U IV and Brachio Tank V are constructed from Wapometal, a special alloy created by former king Wapol.

sources.title: Brachio Tank V - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Starting from Episode 279, One Piece stopped using ending themes, so Episode 556 only features the opening theme 'We Go!' by Hiroshi Kitadani.
